intro: Hieracium aurimontanum, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow-orange flower heads consist of numerous small florets, and it produces fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium aurimontanum is often found in disturbed habitats and can sometimes be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
